headline: Apple calls on Google to help smarten up Siri and bring other AI features to the iPhone
summary: Apple will rely on Google to help finish its efforts to smarten up its virtual assistant Siri and bring other artificial intelligence features to the iPhone as the trendsetting company plays catch up in technology's latest craze.  The deal allowing Apple to tap into Google's AI technology was disclosed Monday in a joint statement from the Silicon Valley powerhouses.  The partnership will draw upon Google's Gemini technology to customize a suite of AI features dubbed “Apple Intelligence” on the iPhone and other products.

raw.headline: Apple calls on Google to help smarten up Siri and bring other AI features to the iPhone

The deal allowing Apple to tap into Google's AI technology was disclosed Monday in a joint statement from the Silicon Valley powerhouses.  The partnership will draw upon Google's Gemini technology to customize a suite of AI features dubbed “Apple Intelligence” on the iPhone and other products.

headline: AI Bond Sales Could Hit $300 Billion a Year, Bank of America Says
summary: Large technology companies racing to develop artificial intelligence will likely issue between $140 billion and $300 billion of corporate bonds annually in the next three years, according to research by Bank of America.  Debt investors have already shown some signs of fatigue, demanding about one-third of a percentage point of extra yield compared to benchmark Treasuries to buy recent bonds.

raw.headline: AI Bond Sales Could Hit $300 Billion a Year, Bank of America Says

headline: Alphabet Becomes Newest $4 Trillion Company, Joining Nvidia
summary: Google parent  Alphabet  value topped $4 trillion in intraday trade, making it the latest tech company to cross that threshold as investors reward the internet-search leader for its artificial-intelligence gains.  Shares in  Alphabet  rose 1.66% to a record $334.04 on Monday morning, putting its market capitalization at $4.03 trillion for a time.  Four technology companies have traded at market capitalizations of $4 trillion, and only  Nvidia  is still above that mark.
